ALD.ALD_relay package¶

Submodules¶

ALD.ALD_relay.ald_relay_hardware module¶

Created on Jan 30, 2018

@author: Alan Buckley <alanbuckley@lbl.gov>
<alanbuckley@berkeley.edu>
class ALD.ALD_relay.ald_relay_hardware.ALDRelayHW(app, debug=False, name=None)¶

Bases: ScopeFoundry.hardware.HardwareComponent

connect()¶

Opens a connection to hardware and connects LoggedQuantity settings to related hardware functions and parameters

create_pulse_lq()¶

Generates LoggedQuantities responsible for issuing or reading pulse signals.

create_toggle_lq()¶

Generates LoggedQuantities responsible for issuing or reading pulse signals.

disconnect()¶

Disconnects the hardware and severs hardware–LoggedQuantity links

enable_pulse()¶

Establishes Hardware–LoggedQuantity connection for relay pulse signals.

enable_toggle()¶

Establishes Hardware–LoggedQuantity connection for relay toggle signals.

name = 'ald_relay_hw'¶
populate()¶

Populate LoggedQuantities to reflect changes in self.relay.relay_array

setup()¶

Runs during __init__, before the hardware connection is established Should generate desired LoggedQuantities, operations

write_pulse1(value)¶

Writes pulse command to relay hardware. Reads LoggedQuantity self.settings.pulse_width1 for pulse duration and then sends command to relay via serial command.

Arguments Type Description Valid Range
value bool or int State to be written to pulse valve
  • (0, 1)
  • True/False
Argument Description
True (1) Open
False (0) Closed

Note, this function is only assigned a True value once its associated LoggedQuantity is clicked. Said LoggedQuantity automatically reverts to False after pulse window has elapsed.

write_pulse2(value)¶

Writes pulse command to relay hardware. Reads LoggedQuantity self.settings.pulse_width2 for pulse duration and then sends command to relay via serial command.

Arguments Type Description Valid Range
value bool or int State to be written to pulse valve
  • (0, 1)
  • True/False
Argument Description

Note, this function is only assigned a True value once its associated LoggedQuantity is clicked. Said LoggedQuantity automatically reverts to False after pulse window has elapsed.

write_relay1(value)¶

Writes relay toggle signal to relay hardware, specifically Relay 1.

Arguments Type Description Valid Range
value bool or int State to be written to pulse valve
  • (0, 1)
  • True/False
Argument Description
True (1) Open
False (0) Closed

Note, this function is only assigned a True value once its associated LoggedQuantity is clicked. Said LoggedQuantity automatically reverts to False after pulse window has elapsed.

ALD.ALD_relay.ald_relay_interface module¶

Created on Jan 30, 2018

@author: Alan Buckley <alanbuckley@lbl.gov>
<alanbuckley@berkeley.edu>
class ALD.ALD_relay.ald_relay_interface.ALDRelayInterface(port='COM4', debug=False)¶

Bases: object

close()¶

Closes serial connection and throws out serial object.

name = 'ALD_relay_interface'¶
poll()¶

Ask Arduino to report on relay states by running self.resp_loop() :returns: self.relay_array

resp_loop()¶

Read multi-line output of polling function and fill out self.relay_array

send_pulse(pin, duration)¶

Order a relay to send a pulse.

Arguments Type Description Valid Range
pin int Relay channel to actuate (1,4)
width int Duration pulse should remain open in milliseconds (10,)
write_cmd(cmd)¶

Sends serial command to the Arduino with proper formatting. Retrieves response from the unit.

Arguments Type Description
cmd str Command or query to be sent to the Arduino.
Returns:(str) Arduino’s response to query.
write_state(pin, value)¶

Manually toggle a relay

Arguments Type Description Valid Range
pin int Boolean integer which tells the controller whether or not to run its PID control mode. See table below. (0, 1)
value bool or int State to be written to pulse valve
  • (0, 1)
  • True/False
Argument Description
True (1) Close
False (0) Open

ALD.ALD_relay.ald_relay_measure module¶

Created on Jan 31, 2018

@author: Alan Buckley <alanbuckley@lbl.gov>
<alanbuckley@berkeley.edu>
class ALD.ALD_relay.ald_relay_measure.ALDRelayMeasure(app)¶

Bases: ScopeFoundry.measurement.Measurement

name = 'ald_relay_measure'¶
run()¶

run method runs in an separate thread and is used for data acquisition

No GUI updates should occur within the run function, any Qt related GUI work should occur in update_display()

setup()¶

Override this to set up logged quantities and gui connections Runs during __init__, before the hardware connection is established Should generate desired LoggedQuantities
